answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have done some research on your question and found some sites that may be useful to you.
The Iowa State University has the state’s vendor policy posted on their website since it extends to them as well. Below is the link to Iowa’s policy.
http://policy.iastate.edu/policy/conflict/vendors
In Texas they also ban such situations and the link below goes to more information about the documents they use in conjunction with their policy.
http://www.ethics.state.tx.us/whatsnew/conflict_forms.htm
Also, I found another example of this type of policy from the University of California, Santa Cruz. While the bottom half deals with family, employees, and vendors, the top has some general wording you might find useful.
http://purchasing.ucsc.edu/howto/employeevendorpolicy.html
I have also included two general documents from the ICMA Knowledge Network. One which highlights some of the common vendor- government relations pit falls and the other the Vendor Manual from Miami Dade County, Florida. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2236/Avoiding_Pitfalls_with_Vendors_and_Advisory_Groups
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7070/Ethics_Guide_for_Businesses_MiamiDade_County_Florida
I hope these offer you some help while writing your own policy.
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
